reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Out-of-camp response to emergency SNFI needs of vulnerable households displaced and/or affected by the Hawiga operation

description.narrative:
Through this proposed action, ACTED has partnered with PIN and Human Appeal under a Consortium to respond to the basic needs of vulnerable households who have been displaced and/or affected by the Hawiga response. Partners will target vulnerable IDP, returnee and stayee households in Hawiga district (with a possibility to intervene in Salah Al Din governorate, but also Ninewa and Erbil governorate if needs arise). ACTED and PIN (as Alliance2015) will respond in Northern Hawiga district and Shirqat, operating from PIN’s Shirqat base. Human Appeal will respond to needs in South / West of Hawiga district, operating from their base in Tikrit.
ACTED, Human Appeal and PIN will distribute: 1780 Emergency Sealing Off Kits (600 by ACTED, 680 by Human Appeal and 500 by PIN) 1780 Winterized Basic Non-Food Item kits (600 by ACTED, 680 by Human Appeal and 500 by PIN) 750 Winter top ups (heating) (only PIN).
Partners expect that, given the needs in the areas of intervention, the same households will be targeted with ESOKs and Winterized BNFIs, as well as winter top up (heating) where relevant. Partners have taken this consolidated approach and have adapted it to reflect their current stocks and other winterization activities planned to take place as part of the Hawiga response.
ACTED and Human Appeal will be providing ESOKs and Winterized BNFIs to the same beneficiary households. Should needs for winter top up (heating) be identified, ACTED and Human Appeal will ensure that those needs are met thanks to already-funded winterization interventions (e.g. ECHO and Shelterbox funds for ACTED). These will complement the NFI assistance provided under this project as needed.
PIN, on the other hand, plans to target households who need all three types of kits ESOKs, winterized BNFIs and winter top ups, using funds allocated to this proposed project. In an effort to ensure a consolidated approach for all its response in the area, PIN would like to procure more winter top up (heating) than winterized BFNI as part of this proposed project, so as to complement the BNFI distributions planned in the same areas of intervention with ECHO-funding.
As such, a minimum of 2030 vulnerable households will be targeted (estimated 12180 individuals, based on the average of 6 individuals per household). Final number of beneficiaries could increase.
The total budget requested for SNFI assistance is USD 1,282,011.45.
